decision_conditions: <p><span style="line-height:normal"><span style="font-size:12.0pt">The glazing&nbsp;proposed in the&nbsp;rear dormer&nbsp;would result in perceived overlooking of the rear gardens of the adjoining properties at number 19 and 21 The Spinney and result in an unreasonable loss of privacy to the occupiers, contrary to the&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies Policy D3.D (1) and (11)&nbsp;of the London Plan (2021), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></span><br></p>

<p><span style="line-height:normal"><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">The proposed side and rear dormers, together with the&nbsp;roof alterations, by reason of their incongruous form, design and height, would fail to respect the scale and proportions of the existing roof form and would give rise to visually obtrusive and overly dominant extensions, to the detriment of the character and appearance of the existing building and the surrounding area, contrary to th</span></span><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span arial="">e high quality design aspirations of National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policies Policy D3.D (1) and (11)&nbsp;of the London Plan (2021), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></span></span><br></p>
